text:
Hey guys it’s Ro, welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today is a very special birthday episode,
yesterday was my birthday, and I have

been recently playing, the cutest game, it’s
called Monsters Ate My Birthday Cake

on my iPad. You’re this little character
Niko, in the world of GoGoPo and there’s

all these monsters and on your birthday the
Monster King Boogen steals your
Birthday Cake, not cool Boogen!

And then you play through the levels, you
team up with other Monsters to get that

cake back! So I thought it would be cute,
today we are gonna be making
Monsters Ate my Birthday Cake… Cake!
Let’s get started!

The thing you will need, will be: Your favorite
pound cake recipe, I’m using a box cake,

and this recipe calls for 2/3 cup of milk,
2 eggs and 1/4 a cup of softened butter,

which is 1/2 a stick of butter. You’ll also
need some baking spray, and you’re gonna

need 2 squares, ah-ah-ah, like me! Just kidding!
You’re gonna need 2 square pans,

these are 6 inches by 6 inches, a big mixing
bowl, a hand mixer. And then to decorate

we’re gonna need some white buttercream
frosting, and some rainbow gumballs,

and a little spatula, now let’s put it all
together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is make
our cake, I’m gonna add our dry ingredients,

then our 2 eggs, I’m gonna do a double handed
crack, just… Because I can’t!
Oooh, there’s a little bit of shell in there!
And then our softened butter.

Now you’re gonna mix it up on a medium speed
for 2 minutes until
everything is evenly combined.

Once your batter’s all mixed up, we are
gonna lightly grease our pans, I’m using

a little bit of baking spray, but you can also
use a little bit of Crisco,
whatever you’d like.

I like to take a little paper towel and just
spread it around, get all the little
corners and the sides.

Now I’m just gonna eyeball it, and pour
1/2 of my batter into this pan and 1/2 of my
batter into the other pan.

Now that the batter is evenly in our pans,
you’re gonna heat your oven to 350

and we’re gonna bake these for about 30
minutes, just keep your eye on ‘em.

You don’t want ‘em to burn. Take a toothpick,
stick it down into the middle of

the cake and pull it out, and when no crumbs
stick to your toothpick, you’ll know
that they’re ready!

Once your cakes have baked and they’ve had
plenty of time to cool, we are gonna

cut and level them. Over here, I’ve cut
off the sides of the cake, usually I don’t

do this, I will just level and then frost
because it’s all covered with frosting.

But because we want to make the cake look
like the cake from the video game,

we are gonna do this first. So you’re just
gonna take a big cutting knife and just cut

off a really small sliver off the sides of
the cake.
Now do this to the other 3 sides of your cake.

Now take your cake leveler and we are gonna
level off the top of the cake.

Hold your cake in place, I like to hold from
the back, and then go back and forth motion.
Saw, saw, saw, saw. Doo-doo-doo-doo-doo!
Nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom-nom!

Now that our cakes are cut and leveled, we
are gonna frost and stack them.

So you’re gonna take your buttercream frosting,
and then we’re just gonna frost a layer
of frosting, right on top of this cake.
Then take your spatula and smooth it out.

Then take your second cake and place it right
on top.

To make the cake look more like the one from
the game, we are gonna take our white

frosting and frost an additional squiggly
line right in the middle in between
where the two cakes meet.

Now that we have frosted the sides of the
cake, we are gonna frost the top of the

cake. And to make it look like the cake from
the game, we are gonna go round
in, out, in, round, on all four sides.

Top of the cake is frosted, and now we’re
gonna smoooooth it out with our must-patula!

Now for our final decoration step, we are
gonna add gumballs on the top of the cake.

This is such a fun idea, I love it! And if
you don’t want to use gumballs, there

are plenty of other candies that you can use,
like Dots, or Airhead Bites, just
whatever candy is colorful and round.

I’m gonna start with my blue gumball and
place him right here, so I’m just
gonna eyeball it and attempt to recreate.

Ta-da! Here is the Monsters Ate my Birthday
Cake… Cake that we made today.

I hope you guys enjoyed this special birthday
episode, I absolutely love this cake,

it’s super simple, and yummy. And if you
have any friends who prefer more cake

to frosting ratio, this is the cake for them
because we did not frost the sides!

Let me know in the comments below whether you like
more cake or more frosting on your cake!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures of this
cake on Facebook, Tumblr, Instagram

and Twitter! And if you guys recreated this
cake, please take a picture and send it

to me. I love to re-blog them and re-post
them, I just get a big kick out of

seeing your baking creations, it just kind
of like, makes my day!

Alright, and if you guys have any other ideas
for any other Nerdy Nummies,

please let me know, leave me a comment down
below and I will do my best to make it happen!
Alright, thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
